intro: Caryophyllata, commonly known as the stonecrop, is a member of the Crassulaceae family. It is a succulent plant characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant typically produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white. Caryophyllata is often found in rocky or well-drained soils, and it is popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to survive in harsh conditions makes it a resilient and ornamental choice for gardeners.
